text: I have a ridiculously easy recipe for
you today you're going to love it it's a
deep-fried chocolate filled wonton it's
so delicious and it's really easy and
you really only need about five
ingredients total I'm just whisking an
egg because that's going to seal the
wontons closed but the real PS to resist
own says this recipe is some chocolate
you need three ounces of chopped
chocolate I'm using milk chocolate you
could certainly use dark chocolate but I
think there's a family friendliness to
the milk chocolate don't you and you
could even use leftover gelt if it's
Chanukah just make sure that when you're
chopping your chocolate you chop it fine
enough that there aren't any big pointy
edges because those will go right
through your wrapper and tear it and
then all your chocolate will be back and
look what I have here here I have some
wonton wrappers you buy these in the
market they're really easy to find you
use the square ones for this you can use
round if those are the ones that you
found though don't worry about the shape
put a teaspoon of chocolate on one edge
of a wrapper and then brush the edge you
can brush two of the edges with your egg
wash that's just your beaten egg and
then fold the other edge over to enclose
the chocolate and you're practically
done any think about that make sure you
press to seal really well otherwise the
chocolate will ooze out while it's
cooking put them on a baking sheet just
continue doing this until they're all
used up this is a fun thing for kids to
help with it's not hard this makes about
24 so you don't need to sit here all day
watching me do this but you get the idea
right I have some oil preheating about
two and a half cups in a small pot
because they're going to be deep fried
so you need about a little under an inch
of oil in a pot I'm just going to use a
piece of wrapper to test the oil it
should sizzle and get brown in about 15
to 20 seconds it's sizzling but I think
it's not quite ready yet
that's good now as with all frying you
want to make sure you don't crowd your
pan so that they Brown evenly and I like
to check the seal on each little one
time before I put it in so that the
chocolate doesn't ooze out and then just
drop it into your hot oil and cook it
until it's golden brown on both sides
you'll want to turn it over
about halfway through the cooking and
that shouldn't take very long because
they cook super fast they're funny right
how adorable they are I'm going to just
take my spider and weigh them down a
little bit so that they cook evenly lift
them up tap off the excess oil and then
toss them in confectioners sugar for a
little blast of sweetness you don't want
too much oil on these but it's okay if
there's a tiny but it helps the
confectioner sugar to stick I have a
little sugar in this bowl I'm just going
to toss them around and then sift more
over the top I like it nice and fine and
then serve these guys up serve them warm
because that's when they're at their
absolute fest and people are going to be
really impressed and they're never going
to know how easy it was what do you
think you're going to make these are you
gonna make them for Hanukkah make them
for anytime they're literally in any
time sweet mmm I don't know about you
but it's my new Hanukkah tradition
